sn56.19:2.1: 2 Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma
sn56.19:4.1: “Mendicants, I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’
sn56.19:4.2: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
sn56.19:4.3: ‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of suffering.’
sn56.19:4.4: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the origin of suffering.’ …
sn56.19:4.5: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.’ …
sn56.19:4.6: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
sn56.19:4.7: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
sn56.19:4.8: ‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
sn56.19:5.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
